title: Robin's Refusal Shows Her Character Growth and Trust in the Straw Hats
theoryText: Robin's decision to refuse Rayleigh's offer to reveal the truth about the Void Century is not just about wanting to discover it herself - it's a profound demonstration of her character growth since Enies Lobby. After spending her entire life running and being used by others for her ability to read Poneglyphs, Robin finally has people she can trust and a journey worth taking. By refusing the shortcut to knowledge, she's choosing the journey with her friends over her lifelong goal, showing that the Straw Hats have become more important to her than the destination.
author: One Piece Community
supportingEvidence: Robin's arc at Enies Lobby established her trust in the Straw Hats
Rayleigh explicitly states that different people might reach different conclusions from the same truth
Robin's smile when declining suggests genuine happiness with her choice

title: Luffy Has the Same Voice of All Things Ability as Roger
theoryText: The revelation that Roger could 'hear the voice of all things' strongly suggests that Luffy possesses the same ability. Throughout the series, Luffy has demonstrated unusual instances of hearing or sensing things others cannot - from understanding Sea Kings at Fishman Island to sensing emotions and intent. This ability may be connected to the Will of D and could be the key to how Luffy will ultimately find the One Piece and understand the true history, just as Roger did.
author: One Piece Community
supportingEvidence: Luffy heard the Sea Kings at Fishman Island
Luffy has shown the same carefree, adventurous personality as Roger
Shanks specifically told Rayleigh about Luffy because he said the same things as Roger
Both Roger and Luffy carry the Will of D

title: Roger Intentionally Created the Great Pirate Era to Find His Successor
theoryText: Roger's voluntary surrender and execution speech were not random acts of defiance - they were carefully calculated moves to spark the Great Pirate Era. Rayleigh's revelation that Roger 'loved flashy things' and enjoyed his Pirate King title despite knowing he would die suggests Roger was orchestrating events. By inspiring a new generation of pirates to seek One Piece, Roger ensured that someone would eventually complete what his crew was 'too early' to accomplish. His execution was the ultimate investment in the future.
author: One Piece Community
supportingEvidence: Roger voluntarily turned himself in rather than being captured
His final words specifically mentioned his treasure and sparked worldwide pirate activity
Rayleigh mentions Roger loved doing things in a flashy, grand style
Later revelations about Roger being 'too early' suggest he knew someone would need to come after him

title: The Voice of All Things is Connected to the Will of D
theoryText: The Voice of All Things ability may not be random - it could be specifically connected to those who carry the Will of D. Roger had it, Luffy appears to have it, and this ability allowed them to understand the ancient history and Poneglyphs in a way that even brilliant scholars couldn't. This suggests the Will of D carriers have an inherent connection to the ancient civilization, possibly making them the 'chosen' ones who can hear the truth that was silenced 800 years ago.
author: One Piece Theory Community
supportingEvidence: Roger (D carrier) possessed the Voice of All Things
Luffy (D carrier) has demonstrated similar abilities
The ability seems to allow understanding of the ancient past, which the World Government tried to erase
Not all D carriers have shown it, suggesting it may require awakening or specific circumstances
counterArguments: Momonosuke has shown ability to hear Zunesha but doesn't carry the D
Not enough confirmed cases to establish definitive connection

title: Shanks Visiting Rayleigh Was to Discuss Luffy's Potential
theoryText: Rayleigh's mention that Shanks visited him ten years ago and told him about a boy in East Blue who said the same things as Roger is highly significant. This wasn't a casual conversation - Shanks may have been seeking Rayleigh's advice or confirmation about Luffy being Roger's spiritual successor. The fact that Shanks gave Luffy Roger's straw hat suggests Shanks recognized Luffy's potential early on and may have been preparing for this moment.
author: One Piece Community
supportingEvidence: Shanks specifically sought out Rayleigh to tell him about Luffy
Shanks gave Luffy his most treasured possession - the straw hat
The timing suggests Shanks recognized something special in Luffy
Rayleigh's interest in meeting Luffy may have been sparked by Shanks's report

title: Different Conclusions Theory - The Truth May Evolve
theoryText: When Rayleigh tells Robin she might reach different conclusions than the Roger Pirates did, this is more than just encouragement - it's a crucial hint about the nature of truth in One Piece. The Roger Pirates learned the history, but Rayleigh suggests that with new context, different people, or different timing, the same historical facts might lead to different interpretations or actions. This could mean that whatever stopped the Roger Pirates (being 'too early') might not stop the Straw Hats.
author: One Piece Theory Community
supportingEvidence: Rayleigh specifically mentions reaching 'different conclusions'
The concept of being 'too early' suggests timing matters
Robin's unique ability to read Poneglyphs combined with her crew's diversity might provide new insights
The world situation has changed significantly since Roger's time
